message.content:
We need to extract from the transactions only those rows that record “Fixed Assets Purchase” (i.e. the purchase of a fixed asset, not the initial balances or expense‐related entries).

Reviewing the table we see two rows with type “Fixed Assets Purchase”:

1. One row with:
 • id: FixedAsset20231231001  
 • type: Fixed Assets Purchase  
 • amount: 362437.67  
 • asset_name: Storage Facilities4  
 • asset_type: Storage Facilities

2. A second row with:
 • id: FixedAsset20231231001  
 • type: Fixed Assets Purchase  
 • amount: 303640.51  
 • asset_name: Processing Equipment5  
 • asset_type: Processing Equipment

These are the only transactions where fixed assets were purchased (the initial “Fixed Assets” record is an opening balance and not a purchase transaction).

We now add these two amounts:

 362437.67 + 303640.51 = 666078.18

Thus, the final purchase of fixed assets recorded in the cash flow statement is 666078.18.

The answer in the required json format is:

-----------------------------------------------------
{"solution": {"Purchase of Fixed Assets": "666078.18"} }
